details.summary: We are responsible for achieving the UK government's policy goals in the Netherlands, as well as services that support the British economy.
details.description: We manage the UK’s relationship with a number of important international institutions based in The Hague.
details.services:
Notarial services

The British Consulate-General Amsterdam provides a limited number of notarial and documentary services by appointment only. Please use our online booking system to book your appointment. Please note that we do not deal with visa/passport enquiries and it is not possible to make an appointment for these services.

Trade Enquiries

UK Trade and Investment (UKTI) helps UK-based companies succeed in the global economy. We also help overseas companies bring their high-quality investment to the UK’s dynamic economy.

Disabled access

The Foreign and Commonwealth Office, the British Embassy The Hague and the British Consulate-General Amsterdam are keen to ensure that their buildings and services are fully accessible to disabled members of the public. Wherever possible, we have made our buildings and services accessible. Sometimes however, this is not possible due to security or other restrictions. In these situations we will endeavour to provide a service or access to a building in an alternative way to ensure equality of access for disabled people. To assist disabled visitors, we have set out below details of disabled access at the British Embassy The Hague. We hope this information is helpful.

British Embassy The Hague

  • entrances: all entrances are on the ground floor and are unobstructed
  • ramps: mobile ramps are available
  • lifts: there is lift accessibility to all floors apart from mezzanines
  • toilets: there is a disabled toilet on the first floor
  • parking: there are no parking facilities at the embassy, although payable public parking spaces can be found nearby
  • floor coverings: all floor coverings are safe and even
  • lighting: lighting in the building is good
  • emergency/evacuation: emergency alarms are loud and there is also a visual alarm; there is an evacuation chair for wheelchair users
  • phones: phones are available at wheelchair height

Access for visually impaired visitors or deaf/hard of hearing visitors

Guide and hearing dogs are welcome.

Contact us

If you need to visit us or use our services and feel that we are inaccessible to you, please contact corporate services, who will try to find an alternative way of providing access for you:

  • email: ukinnl@fco.gov.uk
  • telephone: +31 (0)70 4270 427

details.access_and_opening_times:
Opening hours

Documentary and notarial services by appointment only. Please use the contact form to book an appointment. Consular staff will not be able to book an appointment for you.

Open to the public:

Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday, 9am to 12:30pm

Consular telephone enquiries

Monday to Friday, 9am to 1pm and 2pm to 4:30pm

2013 public holidays

The embassy and the consulate will observe the following official holidays in 2013:

  • Tuesday 01 January
  • Thursday 28 March (afternoon)
  • Friday 29 March

  • Thursday 26 December

Disabled access

The Foreign and Commonwealth Office, the British Embassy The Hague and the British Consulate-General Amsterdam are keen to ensure that their buildings and services are fully accessible to disabled members of the public. Wherever possible, we have made our buildings and services accessible. Sometimes however, this is not possible due to security or other restrictions. In these situations we will endeavour to provide a service or access to a building in an alternative way to ensure equality of access for disabled people. To assist disabled visitors, we have set out below details of disabled access at the British Consulate-General Amsterdam. We hope this information is helpful.

British Consulate-General Amsterdam

  • wheelchair access: the consulate has limited wheelchair access and we arrange for wheelchair users to be seen in the consular section
  • toilets are not really accessible as visitors would need to enter the building and security restraints may prohibit this from happening. The only accessible toilets are in the visa section and stairs may prohibit usage. We have a moveable ramp, which allows access to the ground floor. How convenient it would then be to enable access to toilets on the first floor has not been tested.
  • parking: no general parking is available as there are parking spaces in close proximity to the consulate
  • telephones: access to telephones would be by use of a mobile in emergency situations only
  • signs: we have no signs for disabled visitors at the consulate
  • guide dogs for the blind are welcome. We have no special equipment for deaf or hard of hearing visitors. We have no official signers as all applicants that need the service of an interpreter bring their own. Hearing dogs are welcome
  • security: due to the security restraints on our buildings, especially with visa applicants, all visitors to the consulate would be liable to be searched with a metal detector prior to entry.

Access for visually impaired visitors or deaf/hard of hearing visitors

Guide and hearing dogs are welcome.

Contact us

If you need to visit us or use our services and feel that we are inaccessible to you, please contact John Cameron-Webb, British Consul, who will try to find an alternative way of providing access for you on telephone number +31 (0)20 676 4343.

details.summary: We are responsible for providing assistance to British nationals in the Netherlands
details.description: The British Consulate-General in Amsterdam provides essential services and consular assistance to British nationals in the Netherlands. We are able to issue emergency travel documents but for information on Full Validity Passports please see the link below on Passports.
details.services:
Out-of-hours emergency assistance

British nationals who need emergency assistance outside normal office hours should call +31 (0)20 676 43 43 where they will be given details on how to proceed and how to contact a duty officer if needed.

Emergency travel documents

Information about how to get an emergency travel document if your UK passport is lost or stolen.

Passport renewal

For information on how to apply for your first passport or renew an existing passport, please visit the overseas passport section of this website.

Please note that the Consulate-General cannot deal with individual enquiries about passport applications.

Visas

For information on whether you require a visa for the United Kingdom and how to apply go to the UK Border Agency website.

Please note that the Consulate-General cannot deal with individual enquiries about visa applications. For all visa enquiries, please contact the UK Border Agency.

Notarial and documentary services

Information about official documents, certificates, and notes available at the British Consulate-General in Amsterdam. Appointments for these services can only be made using our online appointment booking system.

Registering a birth or death

Understanding your legal requirements in the Netherlands and how you can register a birth or death, and information on legal documents for couples marrying or entering into civil partnerships abroad.

Guides we produce

We also produce guides for British nationals who need information about services that are not provided by the Consulate-General, but that you may find useful in specific circumstances.

  • Living in the Netherlands

How else we can help

In addition to the services listed above we can also:

  • provide information about transferring funds
  • provide appropriate help if you have suffered rape or serious assault, are a victim of other crime, or are in hospital
  • help people with mental illness *do all we properly can to contact you within 24 hours of being told that you have been detained
  • offer support and help in a range of other cases, such as child abductions, death of relatives overseas, missing people and kidnapping
  • contact family or friends for you if you want
  • make special arrangements in cases of terrorism, civil disturbances or natural disasters

UK law says we have to charge for some services. Details of our current fees and the standards of service you can expect to receive are on display at the Consulate-General in Amsterdam.

What our consulates cannot do for you

Although we try to help British nationals in a wide range of situations, we cannot:

  • get you out of prison, prevent the local authorities from deporting you after your prison sentence, or interfere in criminal or civil court proceedings
  • help you enter a country, for example, if you do not have a visa or your passport is not valid, as we cannot interfere in another country’s immigration policy or procedures
  • give you legal advice, investigate crimes or carry out searches for missing people, although we can give you details of people who may be able to help you in these cases, such as English-speaking lawyers
  • get you better treatment in hospital or prison than is given to local people
  • pay any bills or give you money (in very exceptional circumstances we may lend you some money from public funds, which you will have to pay back)
  • make travel arrangements for you, or find you work or accommodation
  • make business arrangements on your behalf

Travel advice for the Netherlands

Travel advice for the Netherlands. Information, news and updates for the Netherlands to ensure you stay safe, avoid problems, and make informed decisions when living or travelling in the Netherlands.

Legalisation Service

How to get official confirmation that your UK public documentation is genuine so it can be accepted by foreign authorities. The UK does not require any documents to be legalised for use within the UK.

details.description: Documentary and notarial services by appointment only. Please see the "Notarial and documentary services" paragraph above for more information and how to book an appointment. Consular staff will not be able to book an appointment for you.

Disabled access

The consulate has limited wheelchair access and we arrange for wheelchair users to be seen in the consular section. Toilets are not really accessible as visitors would need to enter the building and security restraints may prohibit this from happening. We have a moveable ramp, which allows access to the ground floor. No general parking is available as there are parking spaces in close proximity to the consulate. Access to phones would be by use of a mobile in emergency situations only. We have no signs for disabled visitors. Guide dogs for the blind are welcome. We have no special equipment for deaf or hard of hearing visitors. We have no official signers as all applicants that need the service of an interpreter bring their own. Hearing dogs are welcome. Due to the security restraints on our buildings all visitors to the consulate would be liable to be searched with a metal detector prior to entry.

If you need to visit us or use our services and feel that we are inaccessible to you, please contact John Cameron-Webb, British consul, who will try to find an alternative way of providing access for you:

Telephone +31 (0)20 676 4343

details.summary: UK Trade & Investment (UKTI) helps UK-based companies succeed in the global economy. We also help overseas companies bring their high-quality investment to the UK’s dynamic economy.
details.description:
UKTI offers expertise and contacts through its extensive network of specialists in the UK, and in British embassies and other diplomatic offices around the world. We provide companies with the tools they require to be competitive on the world stage.

Responsibilities

UKTI in the Netherlands helps companies in Britain increase their competitiveness through overseas trade in the Netherlands. We also offer professional, authoritative and personalised assistance to help companies in the Netherlands locate and expand in the UK.

You can find out more about how we are improving trade and investment with the Netherlands.
details.services:
Start a business in the UK

UKTI offers dedicated, professional, personalised assistance to help you locate and expand your business in the UK, read about our investment services or contact us to find out more.

Export from the UK

UKTI can assist you on every step of the exporting journey in both the UK and overseas, read about our exporting services or contact us to find out more.

Events

UKTI and its partners stage events in the UK and abroad to help companies looking to export. You can browse scheduled events and register for alerts.

Business opportunities

UKTI is always looking to provide an international network of opportunities for UK Companies looking to export. You can search these opportunities and register for alerts.
